name: Clinical N Corpus Adenosarcoma/Sarcoma
title: Clinical N
notes:
**Note 1:** When both the Federation Internationale de Gynecologie et d'Obstetrique (FIGO) stage and regional lymph node detail are available, use the regional lymph node detail in preference to a statement of FIGO stage - see Registrar notes.
* If the only information is FIGO III [NOS] or IIIC assign the appropriate stage and leave clinical T, N, and M blank. If the only information is FIGO stage IVB, leave T and N blank and see M

**Note 2:**  Code only regional nodes and nodes, NOS, in this field.  Distant nodes are coded in M (distant metastasis).

**Note 3:**  Regional nodes include bilateral and contralateral involvement of named nodes.

**Note 4:**  If the clinician says "adnexa palpated" but does not mention lymph nodes, assume lymph nodes are not involved.

**Regional lymph nodes**

    Aortic, NOS
        Lateral (lumbar)
        Para-aortic
        Periaortic
    Iliac, NOS
        Common
        External
        Internal (hypogastric)
            Obturator
    Paracervical
    Parametrial
    Pelvic, NOS
    Sacral, NOS
        Lateral (laterosacral)
        Middle (promontorial) (Gerota's node)
        Presacral
        Uterosacral

    Pelvic lymph nodes, NOS

    FIGO Stage IIIC (pelvic or para-aortic lymph nodes)
    FIGO Stage IIIC1 (pelvic lymph nodes)
    FIGO Stage IIIC2 (para-aortic lymph nodes WITH or WITHOUT pelvic lymph nodes)
rows: Regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed

Only information available is FIGO Stage IVA

    Physician unable to assess N
    Regional lymph node involvement cannot be determine or findings inconclusive
Physician assigns cNX, no other information available to determine N

Regional lymph nodes, NOS
Lymph nodes, NOS

In situ case but no pTis is defined by TNM

Only information available is FIGO Stage III [NOS], IIIC, or IVB

Clinical classification criteria not met

    No information about diagnostic workup
    Results not documented in record
Tumor first detected on surgical resection (no clinical workup)
Evidence of metastatic disease [(cM1) or (pM1)], no other workup
